channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: A lawsuit against Tesla and its driver-assistance technology goes to trial in Florida
item.description: The case, which stems from a deadly crash in 2019, raises broader questions about the safety of Tesla's driver-assistance systems, and whether the com...

item.title: With social prescribing, hanging out, movement and arts are doctor's order
item.description: Doctors are writing "social prescriptions" to get people engaged with nature, art, movement and volunteering. Research shows it can help with mental h...

item.title: Flood risk is widespread in the U.S. Few people have insurance for it
item.description: Climate change is increasing the risk of dangerous floods. But people often balk at the cost of flood insurance, especially since many doubt they need...

item.title: I went on a date with my AI dream guy. Then I cried over shrimp
item.description: It started as a one-off dinner with a chatbot — a night of shrimp, sarcasm — then veered into something unsettlingly human.

item.title: When does a conservative lawmaker become moderate? After they disagree with Trump
item.description: Congressional Republicans have become more aligned with President Trump since he first took office. That makes even a single vote against him a "moder...

item.title: Disaster registry may offer false sense of security, disability advocates warn
item.description: Several states have registries to prioritize help for vulnerable residents in natural disasters. But many disability advocates say they endanger peopl...

item.title: Historic lodge destroyed in Grand Canyon blaze
item.description: Tens of thousands of acres of land have been burned by two separate wildfires in the US state of Arizona.

item.title: Historic Grand Canyon Lodge destroyed by expanding wildfire
item.description: The Dragon Bravo Fire has destroyed dozens of structures and a water treatment facility, and the White Sage Fire, located in Kaibab National Forest, h...

item.title: Don't vilify Air India crash crew: Indian pilots' association
item.description: Earlier, India's aviation minister said not to jump to conclusions and another pilots' group criticised the report.

item.title: Boeing fuel switches safe, regulator says after Air India crash
item.description: A preliminary investigation found the switches had been turned off in June's fatal Air India crash.

item.title: 7/13/2025: Healing Justice; Lowriders of New Mexico
item.description: First, a report on exonerees and survivors coming together to heal. And, a look at why lowrider cars are celebrated as a cultural symbol.

item.title: A Bond Broken: The toll of domestic violence on children
item.description: The children left behind and the hidden toll of domestic violence in Chicago.

item.title: Body of former Nigerian leader Buhari to be flown home for simple burial
item.description: Muhammadu Buhari, who led Nigeria as both a military ruler and elected president, died in London on Sunday.

item.title: Armies of Texas volunteers dig out, clean up, after fatal floods
7/13: CBS Weekend News
item.description: New flooding threat in Texas areas recovering from July 4 floods; Tabernacle Choir's "Music and the Spoken Word" airs its 5,000th episode

item.title: German backpacker lost in outback 'beyond grateful' to be found
item.description: Carolina Wilga says she survived for 11 days thanks to the "incredible" support from people searching for her.

item.title: Search for Texas flood victims to resume after pause due to heavy rains
item.description: Search crews are expecting to resume looking for flood victims in Texas after more heavy rains temporarily paused their efforts.

item.title: Two women killed in Kentucky church shooting after trooper shot, police say
